metadata.Title: CVE-2022-24959 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - negligible.
metadata.Description: An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel before 5.16.5. There is a memory leak in yam_siocdevprivate in drivers/net/hamradio/yam.c. It was discovered that the YAM AX.25 device driver in the Linux kernel did not properly deallocate memory in some error conditions. A local privileged attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (kernel memory exhaustion).

notes.Note: sbeattie> requires CAP_NET_ADMIN in the init namespace to exploit

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
